page.title: 02Warrenby Village
page.content:
Warrenby was once a village for the steel workers. It had 12 streets of houses, a school, a Working Men's Club and a pub. One feature of the village was the Hugh Bell Cottages. These cottages were retirement homes for the steel workers. The people who lived in Warrenby were moved to better housing in Redcar during the 1970's.
Today the pub is a bus company depot, the school is a removal firm and the club was recently closed down. Now things are changing. The Hugh Bell Cottages have been renovated and are small workshops.
Coatham Marsh which lies behind the village is now a Nature Reserve. The Marsh is popular with bird watchers and featured on the BBC TV programme "Looks Natural".
